title.narrative: Bishop Tharp Business and Technology Institute 2015 Bishop Tharp Institute Office of the Director

description.narrative: Develop an institutional performance measurement plan with tracking indicators and a tracking system,Improve profitability of BTI income-generating services (business service center, cafeteria, Guest house and bookstore),Regularly update BTI's website,Provide relevant content of BTI's facebook page,Enroll students,Provide interesting courses and degrees.,Graduate students,Hire quality "accredited" Haitian professors,Arrange student learning exchanges (DR, US, other),Host visiting professors (community volunteers),Refer students for internships,Refer students for employment,Study project faisability,Enlist the help of an architect

In the 2015/16 academic year, BTI will strengthen institutional sustainability by completing its guest house by the end of the 2015-2016 academic year. It will also add additional classrooms to accommodate the growing number of students while actively working to promote BTI through its website and social media. Since its inception in 2005, BTI has produced 843 skilled graduates, of which reports show that over 60% are employed in fields such as banking, government administration, and NGO services. In the 2015/16 academic year BTI anticipates an enrollment of 700 students,
